category.title: Places to Eat
category.description: Here is some of our recomendations of places to eat

category.title: The Plough @ Duloe
category.description: 01503 262556 The Plough @ Duloe by Barclay House, Cornwall, PL14 4PN

item.title: The Plough @ Duloe by Barclay house
item.description: The Plough @ Duloe has the best of both worlds nestling in the heart of the Cornish countryside and yet only three miles from the seaside town of Looe in South East Cornwall. Whether wanting a quiet drink, a meal with friends or just a light snack The Plough offers a friendly, warm and inviting atmosphere. A big favourite of both locals and visitors alike
item.contact: 01503 262556 The Plough @ Duloe by Barclay house, Cornwall, PL14 4PN

category.title: Squid Ink
category.description: 01503 262674 Lower Chapel Street East Looe Looe PL13 1AT

item.title: Squid Ink
item.description: Restuarant specialising in local fish and seafood the menu combines contemporary British cooking with Mediterranean and Asian influences and reflects the best local produce that Cornwall has to offer.
item.contact: 01503 262674 Lower Chapel Street East Looe Looe PL13 1AT

category.title: Couch's Great House
category.description: 01503 272554 Saxon Bridge, Polperro, Cornwall, PL13 2QT

item.title: Couch's Great House
item.description: Couch’s Great House Restaurant is situated in the quaint fishing village of Polperro Cornwall. A recent addition to Polperro, it has opened under the direction of Richard McGeown (Executive Head Chef) who hopes to draw from his past experience of working with country’s most famous names.

category.title: Trefanny Hill
category.description: 01503 220622 Duloe, Cornwall, PL14 4QF

item.title: Trefanny Hill
item.description: Our delicious menu is carefully chosen to showcase the wonderful choice of local food and varied daily to take advantage of the freshest produce. We collect our fish fresh from the quay in Looe, all our meat is traditionally reared on local farms, our vegetables are locally grown and we serve Cornish cheeses and ice-creams. We are doing our best to keep food miles to a minimum!

category.title: Little Thai By The Sea
category.description: 01503 231000 Smuggler's Inn Seaton

item.title: Little Thai By The Sea
item.description: Friendly Thai restaurant and Take Away just opposite the Seaton Beach. A great place to gather with friends and family.

category.title: Places To Stay
category.description: Here is some of our recomendations of places to stay

category.title: Tremadart House
category.description: 01503 262766 Tremadart Lane, Duloe, Cornwall, PL14 4PE

item.title: Tremadart House
item.description: For first class Bed and Breakfast in Cornwall, with the VisitBritain **** (4 Star) Quality in Tourism Award, Tremadart House offers a service and a peaceful setting that is exceptional..
item.imageAltText: b n b south east cornwall

category.title: Trussel Barn
category.description: 01579 340450 Trussel Barn St Keyne Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4QL

item.title: Trussel Barn
item.description: Trussel Barn is a converted early 20th century stone barn set in eight acres of land in the heart of an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Views include rolling hilltops and valleys and it has its own wild-life pond at the foot of the property, behind which meanders the East Looe river.
item.contact: 01579 340450 Trussel Barn St Keyne Liskeard Cornwall PL14 4QL
item.imageAltText: b n b south east cornwall

category.title: Well Cottage
category.description: 01579 320147 Well Cottage, Coombe Farm, Herodsfoot, Cornwall, PL14 4RS

item.title: Well Cottage
item.description: Well Cottage is a Five Star ‘Gold’ award, luxury barn conversion situated between Duloe and Herodsfoot. Outstanding facilities include private sauna and gym, and personal chef service. Short breaks available year round, flexible start and finish days
item.contact: 01579 320147 Well Cottage, Coombe Farm, Herodsfoot, Cornwall, PL14 4RS
item.imageAltText: b n b south east cornwall

category.title: Walks
category.description: Some of our favourite walks to suit all levels

category.title: Duloe Loop 3.5
category.description: Distance 3.5 miles Time: 45 mins

item.title: Map of Route
item.description: Starting From bus stop opposite Jubilee club walk up towards church. At church turn right into the green and following the lane down past the school after about a mile turn right into Gillhill woods and follow the trail through to Tremadart woods. Turn right up Tremadart Lane when you get to the top of the lane to left and you will be back where you started.

category.title: Duloe Loop 5
category.description: Distance 5 miles Time: 1:15 mins

item.title: Map of Route
item.description: Starting From bus stop opposite Jubilee club walk up towards church. At church turn right into the green and following the lane down past the school after about a mile turn right into Gillhill woods and follow the trail through to Tremadart woods. Turn left down Tremadart Lane across bridge and up steep hill for 30 yds then turn right onto track into woods. Follow the track until you come to a wooden bridge on the right side. Cross bridge and take path following the river. when you get to the road trun left and follow road up hill at junction to right back towards duloe

category.title: Real Ale Trail
category.description: Rail Ale Trails offer you the opportunity to take a scenic tour of real ales in the West Country

item.title: Real Ale Trail
item.description: Rail Ale Trails offer you the opportunity to take a scenic tour of real ales in the West Country. Experience the beauty of Devon and Cornwall by train and savour the delights of traditional real ales and fine rural pubs along the way. another site good to visit is www.trailsfromthetrack.com which includes guided walks from stations on the Great Scenic Railways of Devon and Cornwall

category.title: Cycle Routes
category.description: Some of our favourite cycle routes to suit all levels

category.title: Road: Duloe Tremadart Looe
category.description: Distance 14 miles

item.title: Map of Route
item.description: Starting From bus stop opposite Jubilee club cycle up towards church. first left down Tremeadart lane down hill for about a mile over bridge and following the hill up (warning 17%) follow lane for further 3 miles then to left towards Pelynt. Cycle through Pelynt and Barcelona at T junction turn left and follow road down into Looe. After crossing bridge follow road around to left up small hill and follow signs for Duloe. On Reaching Sandplace turn left then cross railway bridge and up Sandplace hill. Follow road into Duloe and back to start

category.title: Road: Duloe Downderry
category.description: Distance 20 miles

item.title: Map of Route
item.description: Starting From bus stop opposite Jubilee club cycle up towards church. Down Sanplace hill turn left towards Morval A387 Follow signs for Widegates then Hessenford. At Hessenford to right down towards Seaton at Seaton follow road along seafront and then up into Downderry. carry on on the B3247 and at apporx the 11 mile turn left just keep going straight on on this road until you meet the A374 at Polbathic turn left here. After about a mile turn left onto A387 and follow route back through Hessonford,Widegates Sanplace then Duloe.

category.title: Kayaking
category.description: Places to kayak

category.title: River Fowey, Lerryn to Golant
category.description: Distance: 4 miles Time: 2-3 hrs

item.title: River Fowey Lerryn to Golant
item.description: This route needs to be done 2 hrs either side of high tide. Park up in Lerryn the is a small car park next to the river head of down the river follow the river around to the left after about a nile you should see golant in front off you. Once at Golant paddle under the bridge into the harbour you can always stop of for a pint at the Fishermans Arms. Just reverse the route to return Click Link Below for map of route.

category.title: West Looe River, Looe to Sowdens Bridge
category.description: Distance: 2 miles Time: 1-2 hrs

item.title: Looe to Sowdons Bridge
item.description: This route needs to be done 2 hrs either side of high tide. Park up in Millpool carpark follow the river up to the left Just reverse the route to return Click Link Below for map of route.

category.title: Beaches
category.description: Beaches recommended by locals in cornwall

category.title: Seaton
category.description: Distance from Duloe 8 miles

item.title: Seaton Beach
item.description: A spacious grey sand beach popular with families. All facilities are close by and access to the beach is level. Note that the car parks can get full on hot summer days. At low tide the beach stretches all the way to Downderry beach. There are pleasant walks along the Seaton Valley. Dogs allowed all year round.

category.title: Crantock Bay
category.description: Distance from Duloe 30 miles

item.title: Crantock Bay
item.description: A pleasant sandy beach with a huge expanse of sand at low tide. There are also extensive dunes.

category.title: Whitsand Bay
category.description: Distance from Duloe 14 miles

item.title: Whitsand Bay
item.description: Probably South East Cornwall's best beach with a 3 mile stretch of perfect sand but access to the beach is very steep and only the Tregonhawke part of the beach has toilets. The beach can be used for surfing but there are rip currents and the lifeguard service has been cancelled to save money. The western end of the beach is closed during Tregantle Fort firing range operation.

category.title: Daymer Bay
category.description: Distance from Duloe 30 miles

item.title: Daymer Bay
item.description: A pleasant sandy bay with rock pools to the north of the bay. There are steps to the beach. At low tide the sand stretches south to Rock to form a large expanse of sand.

category.title: Rock Climbing
category.description: Rock Climbing in South East Cornwall
category.imageAltText: rock climbing in south east cornwall

category.title: Downderry
category.description: bouldering on the beach

item.title: www.ukclimbing.com
item.description: Awesome wave of shale/quartz. Classic 35-foot stamina traverse at about V5 with some mega hard sit-downs, up to V7 at present. Main wall is non-tidal with soft sand landings..

category.title: Cheesewring
category.description: climbing on Bodmin moor

item.title: www.ukclimbing.com
item.description: Quarried granite: very slippery when wet. Many excellent routes at all grades, on generally sound rock, with single- and multi-pitch routes up to 120ft.

category.title: The Barn Tavistock
category.description: 01822 870521 Eastacott Barton, Milton Abbott, Tavistock, Devon, PL19 0QP

item.title: The Barn Tavistock
item.description: Indoor climbing wall - bouldering and leading, climbing courses, climbing shop. bouldering competitions, meet climbers. buy climbing equipment. summer bouldering series. lectures. guest speakers. climbing events..
item.contact: 01822 870521 Eastacott Barton, Milton Abbott, Tavistock, Devon, PL19 0QP

category.title: Horse Riding
category.description: Horse riding in South East Cornwall

category.title: Polmartin Farm Lanreath
category.description: We are a BHS Approved Riding School and Place to Train situated in the beautiful and tranquil Cornish countryside, near Lanreath which is close to Looe and Liskeard.

item.title: Polmartin Stables
item.description: Whether it be for teaching others to share our passion, breeding, training or just enjoying their company. The farm is home to around twenty of our equine friends, who have the freedom of over sixty acres of rolling countryside to develop and grow naturally.
item.contact: 01503 220428 Polmartin Farm, Herodsfoot, Liskeard, Cornwall PL14 4RE

category.title: TM International
category.description: For people on holiday who wish to see the Moors from horseback, but are very inexperienced, we offer a package of approximately half an hour basic instruction in the manege followed by a gentle hack up onto the Moor for about an hour

item.title: TM International
item.description: We are approved by the British Horse Society as a Training Centre for career students who wish to take B.H.S. qualifications, up to B.H.S.A.I. You may rest assured, therefore, that if you ride with us you will be correctly taught on responsive, well schooled horses and ponies,
item.contact: 01579 363646 Sunrising Riding Centre, Henwood, Near Liskeard, Cornwall PL14 5BP

category.title: Fishing
category.description: Recommended Fishing in Cornwall

category.title: Bake Lakes Trerulefoot
category.description: 15 acres of water offering fishing for all and natural history in abundance. We have a Kingfisher in residence and rare dragonflies regularly recorded

item.title: Bake Lakes
item.description: 15 acres of water offering fishing for all and natural history in abundance. We have a Kingfisher in residence and rare dragonflies regularly recorded.

category.title: Sea Fishing Looe
category.description: Enjoy a days fishing for Blue Sharks from Englands premier shark fishing port, aboard two of the ports fastest angling vessels. Leaving Looe at 9am to steam appx. 1 - 1.5 hours to the gulf stream 15-20 miles from the port. You are then supplied with mackerel Rods.

item.title: Sea Fishing Looe
item.description: Enjoy a days fishing for Blue Sharks from Englands premier shark fishing port, aboard two of the ports fastest angling vessels. Leaving Looe at 9am to steam appx. 1 - 1.5 hours to the gulf stream 15-20 miles from the port. You are then supplied with mackerel Rods.

category.title: Siblyback Water Park and Colliford Lake
category.description: for traditional fly fishing for stocked rainbows at Siblyback (bank and boat) and traditional fly fishing for natural brown trout at Colliford (bank fishing only). Ample car parking. Peninsula gift shop and tea room. Siblyback Season 1st April to 31st October. Colliford Season 15th March to 12th October.

item.title: Siblyback and Colliford
item.description: for traditional fly fishing for stocked rainbows at Siblyback (bank and boat) and traditional fly fishing for natural brown trout at Colliford (bank fishing only). Ample car parking. Peninsula gift shop and tea room. Siblyback Season 1st April to 31st October. Colliford Season 15th March to 12th October.

category.title: Lostwithiel Hotel
category.description: Course fishing A large lake set in attractive surroundings at the centre of our golf course. The lake is well stocked with Common, Mirror, and Crucian Carp; Tench, Roach small to large, and good sized eels.

item.title: Lostwithiel Hotel
item.description: Course fishing A large lake set in attractive surroundings at the centre of our golf course. The lake is well stocked with Common, Mirror, and Crucian Carp; Tench, Roach small to large, and good sized eels.
